author: dunn
body:
The OSX build instructions have the following line:

```
brew link --force openssl
```

This is not recommended and, as of https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/597 is not possible, since it can create a header/library mismatch.  See that PR and https://langui.sh/2015/07/24/osx-clang-include-lib-search-paths/ for more information on the issue and the security implications.

So, a recommendation, and a question:
- For bootstrapping PowerShell, instead of trying to link OpenSSL to `/usr/local`, you should instruct users to pass `$(brew --prefix)/opt/openssl` to the compiler.
- Is the `.pkg` release of PowerShell build with a force-linked OpenSSL?  If so you should double-check that it's linked correctly.
